last_post.content:
The 2.0 release of Automerge is a huge milestone for local-first software. If you're interested in developing great multi-user, multi-device software without needing massive infrastructure, it's worth reading this post in full.

https://automerge.org/blog/automerge-2/

Highlights: a rewrite in Rust (10-100x on speed and memory use), C bindings plus WASM-complied Javascript, corporate and individual sponsorship, and a roadmap of future features for 3.0.

title: Extracting Training Data from Diffusion Models

last_post.content:
Stable Diffusion can memorize and output impages from its training set, including copyrighted content

https://arxiv.org/abs/2301.13188

Catastrophic (and to be frank - hugely depressing)

This new research in @PNASNews suggests earth will cross the 1.5 degrees C temperature increase threshold in the next decade (within just 10 to 15 years) and is likely to exceed 2 degrees C by around 2060.

This should be THE lead story on the news today (and onwards) and the lead action point for our governments. It should trigger a massive call for real global action to combat the #climateemergency - sadly though I fear this news will barely register.

We have to stop believing the siren calls of future technology solutions and #carbonoffsets - the immediate need is a rapid end to the use of #fossilfuels and a massive rollout of #renewableenergy

https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.2207183120

#ClimateChange #ClimateCrisis

I have to say, CatGPT is scarily accurate. Machine learning has come a long way.

https://catgpt.wvd.io/

If you are still using Twitter, do not -- DO NOT -- use direct messages for anything you consider sensitive in any way. This goes triple for the journalists who insist on pouring their work into a site whose sociopath CEO has utter contempt for the press.

https://www.platformer.news/p/another-whistleblower-comes-for-twitter

Really great thread on practical reality of applying hard access control at large orgs. Every org I’ve seen this at, it has gone horribly wrong - if you lock out 10% of your staff, you denial of service attack your own org (and job). https://infosec.exchange/@SecurityWriter/109777576538835360

Want to help out with development of Toot!? I have been doing some large internal rewriting, and probably introduced some exciting new bugs in the process, so I thought it might be best to do a public beta for this version to shake them out a bit before release.

The link to join the beta is here: https://testflight.apple.com/join/x0MbQhMF

Only join if you are happy to deal with some bugs! Or, if you want a free trial of Toot! and don’t mind a potential bug or two.

I'm excited to serve on this new National Academies (NASEM) consensus study: "Pathways to Doctoral Degrees in Computing," contributing my expertise on faculty careers, interdisciplinary computing, and the science of science. If you have suggestions to share, DM me! https://www.nationalacademies.org/our-work/pathways-to-doctoral-degrees-in-computing

As someone who is routinely annoyed by org value statements ("Integrity!"), I've written up my approach to writing useful values, particularly from an engineering org's perspective, make them: (1) reversible, (2) applicable, and (3) honest.

Full notes at https://lethain.com/setting-engineering-org-values/

A number of folks have reached out to us over the past few months asking how they could help Mastodon out. Unfortunately, we haven't had the capacity to accept those kind offers at the time.

If you're interested in getting involved as a volunteer, please fill out this form (and share it around!) so we know who could help with what. (There is plenty that needs doing!)

https://joinmastodon.typeform.com/to/PdqUZCAg

REPLUG: Retrieval-Augmented Black-Box Language Models

REPLUG with the tuned retriever significantly improves the performance of GPT-3 (175B) on language modeling by 6.3%, as well as the performance of Codex on five-shot MMLU by 5.1%.

Here's a fun mystery to ponder on a Monday evening... the GitHub robots.txt file at https://github.com/robots.txt includes the following rules:

```
Disallow: /ekansa/Open-Context-Data
Disallow: /ekansa/opencontext-*
```
https://github.com/ekansa/Open-Context-Data is the ONLY repository on the whole of GitHub that gets explicitly listed in robots.txt like that

There's clearly a story there! I wonder what it is

title: Trust & Safety Research Conference Announced for September 28-29, 2023

last_post.content:
After an incredible, sold-out Trust and Safety Research conference pulled together 450 people from across academia, industry and civil society to discuss online harms, we have announced that we are making this a thing with the second edition being held Sep 28-29 at Stanford!

There will be a special edition of the Trust and Safety Research Journal (tsjournal.org) as proceedings. Peer-reviewed articles due April 30, commentaries due August 1.

See you there!

https://cyber.fsi.stanford.edu/io/news/trust-safety-research-conference-announced-september-28-29-2023

Today I got a surprising and disheartening email from Wes of #Oakland & #Berkeley based Pitch Interactive notifying their contacts that they will be shutting their doors after 16+ years.

Pitch is *the* reason I became interested in #dataviz, after seeing their powerful piece on U.S. drone strikes titled, “Out of Sight, Out of Mind”: https://drones.pitchinteractive.com/

If you’re not familiar with Pitch and their work take a minute to check out their website: https://www.pitchinteractive.com/

Sad to hear @pitchinc@twitter.com is winding down —
thank you for 16+ years of #dataviz inspiration!

Check out their site if you haven't: https://www.pitchinteractive.com.

Absolute #dataviz classic: https://www.pitchinteractive.com/work/drones/

Best wishes for everybody on the team — you can truly be proud.

Last week I was talking about how awesome it would be if some of the people who have been laid off recently from 'Big Tech' jobs decided to form #coops.

There seemed to be a need for more info around this, so I had a meeting with CoTech colleagues @BillySmith @chrislowis & @Graham_Mitchell to figure out something practical.

Pleased to show MVP site as a result of this at https://start.coops.tech

There are five of us - including @KingMob - volunteering initially. Please share widely!

title: watershed moment for the BJD: Authors retain their article copyright

last_post.content:
The British Journal of Dermatology just moved from #Wiley to #OUP. As part of the move, it's adding plain language summaries (#PLS) and allowing authors to retain #copyright in their articles.
https://academic.oup.com/bjd/article/188/1/1/6795460

The journal remains #hybrid, not full #openaccess. But note that the key #RightsRetention step was voluntarily adopted by a #society (British Association of Dermatologists) and a #UniversityPress. Kudos to them both.

#nonprofit
